{"id":626934087,"lang":"cpp","time":"8 months, 1 week","timestamp":1643047728,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"24 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/626934087/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Integer to Roman","memory":"11.1 MB","code":"/*\n~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~\n--||author : codechaser||-- \n~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    string intToRoman(int n) {\n        unordered_map<int, string> mp;\n        mp[1] = \"I\"; mp[5] = \"V\"; mp[10] = \"X\"; mp[50] = \"L\"; mp[100] = \"C\"; mp[500] = \"D\"; mp[1000] = \"M\";\n        mp[4] = \"IV\"; mp[9] = \"IX\";\n        mp[40] = \"XL\"; mp[90] = \"XC\";\n        mp[400] = \"CD\"; mp[900] = \"CM\";\n        int p = 0;\n        string ans = \"\";\n        while (n > 0) {\n            int x = pow(10, p);\n            int nm = x * (n % 10);\n            n /= 10;\n            if (mp.count(nm)) {\n                ans = mp[nm] + ans;\n            }\n            else {\n                int cnt = nm / x;\n                if (cnt <= 5) {\n                    for (int i = 0; i < cnt; i++) ans = mp[x] + ans;\n                }\n                else {\n                    string t = mp[5 * x];\n                    for (int i = 0; i < cnt - 5; i++) t += mp[x];\n                    ans = t + ans;\n                }\n            }\n            p++;\n        }\n        return ans;\n    }\n};\n////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////\n/*\n    |---------------------------------------------------|\n    |||   https://codeforces.com/profile/codechaser   |||\n    |||   https://www.codechef.com/users/codechaser   |||\n    |||        https://github.com/code-chaser         |||\n    |---------------------------------------------------|\n*/\n////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////","compare_result":"","title_slug":"integer-to-roman"}
